body:
## What's Changed
* Fix #247 ensure binary compatibility from now by @ohze in https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/pull/248

## New Contributors
* @ohze made their first contribution in https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/pull/248

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/compare/v1.0.1...v1.0.2

WARNING: This version accidentally broke binary compatibility with version 1.0.0. Version 1.0.2 corrects the problem; please use that instead.

* Declare a version policy (#241)

This release was brought to you by 4 contributors, according to `git shortlog -sn --no-merges v1.0.0..`. Thank you Scala Steward, Seth Tisue, kenji yoshida, Julien Richard-Foy.

* Support Scala 3.0.0 (#229)
* Add `Automatic-Module-Name` (#225)

This release was brought to you by 2 contributors, according to `git shortlog -sn --no-merges v1.0.0-RC1..`. Thank you Seth Tisue, Scala Steward.

name: 1.0.0-RC1
body:
* Add support for Scala 3.0.0-RC2 (#215, #216)
* Declare version scheme (#211)

This release was brought to you by 5 contributors, according to `git shortlog -sn --no-merges v0.9.1..`. Thank you Scala Steward, Seth Tisue, Sean C. Sullivan, Will Sargent.

name: v0.9.1
body:
User-visible changes:

* Fixes https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/issues/107 ("Incorrect OSGi manifest").

Other changes:

* Build and publishing infrastructure overhauled.

This release was brought to you by 5 contributors, according to `git shortlog -sn --no-merges HEAD ^v0.9.0#2.13.0`. Thank you Scala Steward, Lukas Rytz, Seth Tisue, Eugene Yokota, Ikhun Um.
* Add converters between `scala.concurrent.duration.FiniteDuration` and `java.time.Duration` ([PR #86](https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/pull/86); thank you @johanandren!)

- This release adds converters between Scala collections and Java 8 streams. See the main README.md for details.
- Cross built for Scala 2.11 and Scala 2.12

name: Scala 2.12.0-RC1-support
body: Another attempt at building a release with support for Scala 2.11, 2.12.0-M5 and 2.12.0-RC1, after v0.8.0-RC4 and v0.8.0-RC5 didn't publish all required artifacts.

name: New release with Scala 2.12.0-M5 support
body: This release adds some refinements to the Stepper encoding for streams compatibility and is built on Scala 2.11.8 and 2.12.0-M5 (instead of 2.12.0-M4).

name: New release with Scala 2.12.0-M5 support
body:
Wrong commit tagged. This release was not published.

~~This release adds some refinements to the Stepper encoding for streams compatibility and is built on Scala 2.11.8 and 2.12.0-M5 (instead of 2.12.0-M4).~~

name: Java 8 Streams interop
body:
This release adds converters between Scala collections and Java 8 streams. See the main README.md for details.

It is cross-built against Scala 2.11 and 2.12.0-M4. On 2.11 it comes with JFunction classes (now in `scala.runtime.java8` instead of `scala.compat.java8`) for interoperability with Java 8 lambdas. 2.12.0-M4 includes these classes in the standard library instead.

name: v0.6.0
body:
- Refinements to the `Future` converters
- Converters for `java.util.function._`

See the corresponding [milestone](https://github.com/scala/scala-java8-compat/issues?q=milestone%3A0.6.0+is%3Aissue) for a full list of fixed issues.

name: v0.4.0
body:
- Add converters for Java's `Optional` and `Iterator`
- Use Scala's boxing semantics, rather than Java's (`null` is reintepreted as 0 during unboxing).

name: v0.2.0
body:
This is the first binary release of this module.

The API is still experimental: future releases may break source or binary compatibility.
